page.title: 08DOUNBY FARM STUDY: FUTURE
page.content: In the{future,}Mr. Hourston thinks that there won't be so much work to do on the farm by hand. There will be a lot more machines instead and less workers. No-one who doesn't have a lot of money will be able to buy a farm. Farmers will probably find it cheaper to hire contractors to do some of their work as they won't be able to afford to buy some kinds of machinery. He is also worried that EEC grants will stop or be cut and force him to change from beef cattle. The biggest problem with{farming? There isn't much time off to do other things.
